ud5.2:1.5: Here I use “Blessed One” rather than my usual “Buddha” for bhagavā. Normally the difference is immaterial, as it is simply the most common way to address the Buddha. In this case, however, the passage Ānanda is referring to uses bodhisatta, and it is quite striking that he changes it here.
ud5.2:2.1: The Buddha switches back to bodhisatta, and depersonalizes it by using the plural.
